title: Energy industry and cleaner cars helped to knock a third off UK's carbon emissions
text:
The green energy revolution and cleaner cars have helped cut Britain’s carbon emissions by a third as the economy weans itself off fossil fuels, new research shows.

Total carbon emissions, including those that are “imported” from abroad, peaked in 2007 and have fallen since, the Office for National Statistics (ONS) found.

The carbon-intensive energy industry saw the biggest plunge in UK-generated emissions between 1985 and 2016, dropping 67pc as suppliers switched from dirty fossil fuels, such as coal, to natural gas and renewable sources.

More efficient and cleaner vehicles knocked a third off transport emissions, while gases from factories slid by 43pc according to the ONS.
